name: Clin T Adrenal Gland
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  TNM does not include an in situ category for adrenal gland tumors. Assign 88 and behavior code /2 for in situ cases.

**Note 2:** Tumor size must be known to assign a value of T1 or T2. You may use a physicianâs statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record. If the tumor appears to be in the T1 or T2 categories, but no size or category is specified, assign TX.

**Note 3:** For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category based on the tumor size.

    Invasive carcinoma confined to adrenal gland
    Localized, NOS
rows:
Clinical evaluation performed but unknown results or extension not stated 
Clinical evaluation performed but results not documented in patient record
Size is part of the T definition and the size is not available but information states that the tumor is confined to the primary

Tumor 5 cm or less in greatest dimension 
No extra-adrenal invasion

Tumor greater than 5 cm
NO extra-adrenal invasion

Tumor of any size with local invasion, 
NOT invading adjacent organs

Adjacent connective tissue 
   Gerota  fascia

Stated as T3
Tumor of any size with invasion of adjacent organs

Adjacent organs/structures:
    Kidney, ipsilateral or NOS
    Pancreas
    Retroperitoneal structures including:
        Great vessels:
            Aorta
            Inferior vena cava

Further contiguous extension including:
    Diaphragm
    Liver
    Spleen

Stated as T4

Clinical T is not defined for this site/histology
In situ (no pTis defined)

No clinical evaluation
Cancer first detected on surgical resection
